summary: The Stop Mental Health Stigma in Our Communities Act of 2025 aims to improve behavioral health within the Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) population. It mandates a national outreach and education strategy to reduce stigma associated with mental health and substance use disorders, tailored to the diverse needs of AANHPI communities. The bill also calls for systematic reviews and reports addressing the AANHPI youth behavioral health crisis and workforce shortages in the mental health field. The bill authorizes appropriations for these initiatives, focusing on research, outreach, and workforce development.
